channel.title: Krishna Somandepalli
channel.description: PhD Student, Signal Analysis and Interpretation Laboratory, USC

item.description:
I am a third year PhD student at the University of Southern California (USC) Viterbi School of Engineering. I am a member of the Signal Analysis and Interpretation Laboratory (SAIL) and advised by Prof. Shri Narayanan.

My research interests are primarily in the areas of multimodal signal representation and open set recognition using neural networks. At SAIL, I coordinate the efforts of the Media Informatics and Content Analysis (MICA) group in developing engineering models for a quantitative study of multimedia content.

Prior to USC, I worked as a research scientist at NYU Langone Medical Center, NYC after receiving my masters degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from University of California at Santa Barbara.
